page.title: 04Bletchley
page.content: Bletchley Manor was built in 1639.It is painted black and white in the Elizabethan style.There are 100 acres and 80 cows.It is a mixed farm.There are 7 fields used for grazing,silage, corn,potatoes and carrots.Fertilizer and irrigation are used.Cheese used to be made at the farm,but now it has a farm shop.There is a pond and a wood. A family of six live there. The Castle Hotel has a restaurant. There are a slot machine and a video game,also a bar and a lounge. Royal Oak Farm,built in 1503,is a fine Elizabethan building now leaning to one side.The land is used for pasture by a neighbouring farmer. Farm Pak cuts and packs meat.The meat is sold to schools,cafes and shops all over the country.Twelve people are employed.There is half an acre of land.
